member.name: P:SocketJack.Globals.threadManager

member.summary: Manages all Tcp Client and Server threads.

member.summary: All TcpServer instances.

member.name: P:SocketJack.ThreadManager.Timeout
member.summary: Time in Milliseconds to wait before timing out.

member.name: P:SocketJack.ThreadManager.UseGlobalTickLoop
member.summary: When enabled, a single global tick loop will flush send queues for all connections on the same cadence (based on the highest configured FPS across sockets). Disabled by default to preserve legacy per-connection sending behavior.

member.name: M:SocketJack.ThreadManager.Shutdown
member.summary: Must be called on application shutdown to ensure all threads are closed.

member.name: T:SocketJack.Net.HttpClient
member.summary: Minimal HTTP/HTTPS client supporting headers, content-length, chunked transfer, and redirects.

member.name: T:SocketJack.Net.HttpServer.StreamRouteHandler
member.summary: Delegate for streaming routes. The handler receives a that sends each as an HTTP chunk, keeping the connection open until the handler returns or calls .

member.name: M:SocketJack.Net.HttpServer.MapStream(System.String,System.String,SocketJack.Net.HttpServer.StreamRouteHandler)
member.summary: Maps a streaming route. The handler receives a it can write to line-by-line. The connection stays open until the handler returns.

member.name: P:SocketJack.Net.HttpServer.ChunkedThreshold
member.summary: Minimum body size in bytes before the server switches to chunked transfer encoding. Bodies smaller than this are sent with Content-Length in a single write. Default is 8 KB.

member.name: P:SocketJack.Net.HttpServer.ChunkedSize
member.summary: Size of each chunk when using chunked transfer encoding. Default is 4 KB.

member.name: M:SocketJack.Net.HttpServer.ParseHttpRequest(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Parses a raw HTTP request string into an HttpRequest object.

member.name: M:SocketJack.Net.HttpResponse.WriteChunkedTo(System.IO.Stream,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes the response to using HTTP/1.1 chunked transfer encoding. Each line of text is sent as its own chunk so the client can render progressively. For binary (non-text) bodies, falls back to fixed-size chunks.

member.name: T:SocketJack.Net.ChunkedStream
member.summary: Wraps a network stream with HTTP/1.1 chunked transfer encoding. Write lines or raw data; each write is sent as an individual chunk and flushed immediately so the client can render progressively. Call (or let the server call it) to send the terminating chunk.

member.name: M:SocketJack.Net.ChunkedStream.WriteLine(System.String)
member.summary: Sends a single line of text (with trailing newline) as one HTTP chunk.

member.name: M:SocketJack.Net.ChunkedStream.Write(System.String)
member.summary: Sends text as one HTTP chunk without appending a newline.

member.name: M:SocketJack.Net.ChunkedStream.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sends arbitrary bytes as one HTTP chunk.

member.name: M:SocketJack.Net.ChunkedStream.Finish
member.summary: Sends the terminating zero-length chunk. Called automatically when the stream route handler returns.

member.summary: Tracks active control-share sessions on the server: (SharerID, ViewerID). Populated when a ControlShareFrame redirect passes through. Used to block unauthorized ControlShareRemoteAction messages.

if accessed before the server identifies the client.

Host name for SSL connections.

member.summary: Override in subclasses to route the ping datagram through the correct send path. Default implementation uses TCP-style .

member.name: M:SocketJack.Net.NetworkBase.StartPingLoop
member.summary: Starts a background loop that sends a every 10 seconds and registers a callback to measure latency. Called automatically by client types after a successful connection.

member.name: M:SocketJack.Net.NetworkBase.StopPingLoop
member.summary: Stops the background ping loop.

member.name: M:SocketJack.Net.NetworkConnection.AdjustThreadPool(System.Int32)
member.summary: Adjusts minimum threads so worker/IO capacity scales with the number of active connections. Without this, the default pool ramp-up (~1 thread per 500 ms) causes server-side deserialization and callback dispatch to fall behind under heavy bot load.

Send an object to a Remote Client on the server.
This will expose your remote IP.

member.name: M:SocketJack.Net.NetworkConnection.SetMetaData(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Set metadata for the connection serialized with Json.
WARNING: This information will be sent to all connected clients.
Set the `Private` parameter to to retain private metadata only on server. Metadata Key. Metadata Value. to keep the metadata only on server; shares with all peers. to restrict the client from updating the metadata value.

member.name: M:SocketJack.Net.NetworkConnection.GetMetaData(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Get metadata value by key for the connection.
Can only be called from server. Metadata Key. Value as string.

member.name: T:SocketJack.Net.NetworkOptions
member.summary:
Default options for , , , and .
These options are used by default unless overridden here.
Set before creating any instances of TcpClient, TcpServer, UdpClient, or UdpServer.
Example:
DefaultOptions.Logging =

member.name: P:SocketJack.Net.NetworkOptions.Serializer
member.summary:
Serializer for both and .
Default is System.Text.Json.

member.name: P:SocketJack.Net.NetworkOptions.CompressionAlgorithm
member.summary:
Compression algorithm for both and .
Default is GZip2.

member.name: P:SocketJack.Net.NetworkOptions.Logging
member.summary: Output OnConnected, OnDisconnected, and OnConnectionFailed events to Console. Send and Receive events only logged when LogSendEvents or LogReceiveEvents are set to True.

member.name: P:SocketJack.Net.NetworkOptions.LogSendEvents
member.summary: Log sent events to console.

summary.para: Log received events to console.

member.name: P:SocketJack.Net.NetworkOptions.LogToConsole
member.summary: Log to Debug Output Window.

summary.para: Turns on or off Peer to Peer functionality.
Required to be set before TcpClient.Connect or TcpServer.StartListening.

member.name: P:SocketJack.Net.NetworkOptions.UpdateConsoleTitle
member.summary: Update the title of the console window with traffic statistics.

member.name: P:SocketJack.Net.NetworkOptions.ConnectionTimeout
member.summary:
Timespan to attempt to connect to a server.
Default is 3 seconds.

member.name: P:SocketJack.Net.NetworkOptions.AutoReconnect
member.summary: When True the client will automatically retry connection to the last used Host / Port.

member.name: P:SocketJack.Net.NetworkOptions.Backlog
member.summary: Maximum concurrent pending connections.
member.returns: 100 is default. Lower to reduce processing time.

member.name: P:SocketJack.Net.NetworkOptions.MaximumBufferSize
member.summary: Maximum buffer size per connection.

member.name: P:SocketJack.Net.NetworkOptions.MaximumDownloadMbps
member.summary: Maximum receiving bandwidth.

remarks.para: Default is 100Mbps. Set to 0 to disable buffering.
Disabling buffer will not work with SSL.

member.name: P:SocketJack.Net.NetworkOptions.DownloadBufferSize
member.summary: Download buffer size. Default is 65536 bytes. Integer

member.name: P:SocketJack.Net.NetworkOptions.MaximumUploadMbps
member.summary:
Maximum Upload bandwidth.
Default is 100Mbps. Set to 0 for unlimited.
Integer

member.name: P:SocketJack.Net.NetworkOptions.UploadBufferSize
member.summary: Upload buffer size. Default is 65536 bytes. Integer

summary.para: Use compression for network transfer.
Must be set before connection started.

member.name: P:SocketJack.Net.NetworkOptions.UseTerminatedStreams
member.summary:
Send and receive objects with terminator (default is ).
to parse objects. An exception would be used in the case of HttpServer where the terminator is not used. HttpServer simply reads to the end of the stream.

member.name: P:SocketJack.Net.NetworkOptions.UseSsl
member.summary: Use SSL for network transfer.

member.name: P:SocketJack.Net.NetworkOptions.Chunking
member.summary:
When enabled, outbound messages are buffered and flushed in large chunks at the interval specified by .
This reduces the number of small writes and syscalls at the cost of added latency.
Default is .

member.name: P:SocketJack.Net.NetworkOptions.ChunkingIntervalMs
member.summary:
The interval in milliseconds between chunked flushes when is enabled.
Default is 100 ms.

member.name: P:SocketJack.Net.NetworkOptions.ChunkingAutomaticLatencyScaling
member.summary:
When , the library automatically adjusts based on measured round-trip latency so chunk flushes stay proportional to network delay.
Requires the built-in ping loop to be active (client-side only).
Default is .

member.name: P:SocketJack.Net.NetworkOptions.Fps
member.summary: Gets or sets the frame rate, in frames per second, for processing operations.
member.remarks: Setting this property adjusts the timing interval used for frame updates. The value should be a positive integer to ensure correct timing behavior. 0 or less = disabled.

member.name: P:SocketJack.Net.NetworkOptions.Whitelist
member.summary: Types that are allowed to be deserialized.

member.name: P:SocketJack.Net.NetworkOptions.Blacklist
member.summary: Types that are not allowed to be deserialized.

member.name: P:SocketJack.Net.NetworkOptions.MaxDatagramSize
member.summary:
Maximum datagram payload size in bytes for UDP.
Datagrams exceeding this size will be rejected with an error.
Default is 65,507 bytes (maximum safe UDP payload). Lower to ~1,400 for safe MTU.

member.name: P:SocketJack.Net.NetworkOptions.ClientTimeoutSeconds
member.summary:
Timeout in seconds before a UDP server considers a client disconnected due to inactivity.
Default is 30 seconds.

member.name: P:SocketJack.Net.NetworkOptions.UdpReceiveBufferSize
member.summary:
Size of the receive buffer used by the UDP socket in bytes.
Default is 65,535 bytes (maximum single UDP datagram size including headers).

member.name: P:SocketJack.Net.NetworkOptions.EnableBroadcast
member.summary:
When enabled, the UDP socket is configured to allow sending broadcast datagrams.
Default is .

member.name: P:SocketJack.Net.NetworkOptions.ClientTimeoutCheckIntervalMs
member.summary:
Interval in milliseconds between client timeout checks on the UDP server.
Default is 5000 ms (5 seconds).

member.name: T:SocketJack.Net.NIC
member.summary: Active Network Interface Card

member.name: P:SocketJack.Net.NIC.MTU
member.summary: Maximum Transmission Unit defined by the currently active NIC.

summary.para: Overhead for Segment Type string for Reflection.
Default is derrived from Typical JSON serialization.
If the Serializer is adding a lot of padding and object transfers are failing, increase this on Client and Server.
Default is 200 (bytes)

summary.para: Check if the internet is available.
Uses Google.com as a test.
Get the Local IP Address of the active NIC.
Uses a UDPClient to get the LocalEndPoint.
Check if a port is available.
Optionally forward the port if available.
Check if a port is available.
Optionally forward the port if available.
Check if a port is available.
Optionally forward the port if available.
Find an open port within a range.
Optionally forward the port if available.
